SEARCH
Package Background

Class TileManager

java.lang.Object
Background.TileManager
public class TileManager extends Object
Description:

Manages tile data for the game including loading tile images and map layouts. Responsible for rendering tile maps and placing interactive tiles like doors.

Author:
mguzelocak, Zelele

  • Field Summary

  • Field Details

    • tile

      public Tile[] tile
      Array to hold different tile types (grass, wall, etc.)

    • mapTileNum

      public int[][] mapTileNum
      Stores tile layout of the current map using tile indices

  • Constructor Details

    • TileManager

      public TileManager(Background gp, int startMap)
      Constructor for the TileManager class. Initializes the tile array and mapTileNum array, then loads tile images and the default map.
      Parameters:
      gp - The Background object that holds the game's environment and properties.

  • Method Details

    • getTileImg

      public void getTileImg()
      Loads tile images and their properties (like collision) from the specified resources. This method reads images for different tiles (e.g., grass, wall) and assigns collision behavior.

    • loadMap

      public void loadMap(int mapNumber)
      Loads the map data from a text file corresponding to the specified map number. The map data is read into a 2D array called mapTileNum, where each entry represents a tile.
      Parameters:
      mapNumber - The number of the map to load (e.g., level1, level2).

    • handleExplosion

      public void handleExplosion(Rectangle explosionArea)
      Handles the explosion logic and replaces soft walls with grass after a bomb explosion. This method updates the map by replacing soft walls (tile[2]) with grass (tile[0]) within the explosion area.
      Parameters:
      explosionArea - The area affected by the explosion.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2d)
      Draws the map on the screen using the Graphics2D object. Iterates over the mapTileNum array and draws the corresponding tile images at the appropriate screen coordinates.
      Parameters:
      g2d - The Graphics2D object used for drawing the tiles on the screen.

    • getCurrentMap

      public int getCurrentMap()
      Gets the current map number.
      Returns:
      The number of the current map.

    • moveDoorToClosestSoftWall

      public void moveDoorToClosestSoftWall(int playerX, int playerY, boolean isCheat)
      Moves the door tile to the closest soft wall tile relative to the player's location. This only applies in cheat mode. It ensures the door appears near the player rather than at random.
      Parameters:
      playerX - the column position of the player
      playerY - the row position of the player
      isCheat - true if cheat mode is enabled; false otherwise

    • getGp

      public Background getGp()
